intro: Boechera angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
